## Overview

**Slice Type:** Progressive Enhancement
**Priority:** Low
**Effort:** 6 hours
**Risk:** Low
**Dependencies:** VS-01 (buttons)

Add haptic feedback for mobile devices and optional audio click sounds.

## User Story

```
As a mobile user
I want tactile and audio feedback
So that I have confirmation of my button presses
```

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Haptic feedback on button press (mobile)
- [ ] Optional audio click sounds
- [ ] Settings to enable/disable feedback
- [ ] Different feedback for different button types
- [ ] Works on supported devices only
- [ ] No errors on unsupported devices

## Technical Requirements

**Haptic Feedback (Vibration API):**

```javascript
function triggerHaptic(type = "light") {
  if (!navigator.vibrate || !settings.hapticEnabled) {
    return;
  }

  const patterns = {
    light: [10],
    medium: [20],
    strong: [30],
  };

  navigator.vibrate(patterns[type]);
}
```

**Audio Feedback:**

```javascript
const audioContext = new (window.AudioContext || window.webkitAudioContext)();

function playClickSound() {
  if (!settings.audioEnabled) {
    return;
  }

  const oscillator = audioContext.createOscillator();
  const gainNode = audioContext.createGain();

  oscillator.connect(gainNode);
  gainNode.connect(audioContext.destination);

  oscillator.frequency.value = 800;
  gainNode.gain.value = 0.1;

  oscillator.start();
  oscillator.stop(audioContext.currentTime + 0.05);
}
```

**Settings:**

- Enable/disable haptics toggle
- Enable/disable audio toggle
- Volume control for audio

## Implementation Checklist

- [ ] Implement Vibration API integration
- [ ] Implement Web Audio API for clicks
- [ ] Create settings panel
- [ ] Add haptic feedback to all buttons
- [ ] Add audio feedback option
- [ ] Feature detection for API support
- [ ] Test on iOS devices
- [ ] Test on Android devices
- [ ] Test settings persistence
- [ ] Ensure graceful degradation
